Hi Stefan,

thank you for your feedback.

The JUnit team itself wants to ge=
t rid of the Hamcrest dependency.
Basically Hamcrest is an assertion librar=
y (like AssertJ, Truth, ...) and
it can be independent from JUnit. Therefor=
e it must only use JUnit's
interfaces (AssertionError and AssumptionViolate=
dException) and JUnit must
not use Hamcrest. Both is possible, but it needs=
 a new JUnit major release.

ciao,
stefan
